com.ecs.utils.stellent
Class ServiceUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.stellent.ServiceUtils
public class ServiceUtils
extends java.lang.Object

The class contains utility classes for calling a Stellent service. These methods must only be used if invoked from within the Stellent CS process, they cannot be invoked from a remote process.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nicolas Brachfogel

Method Detail

callService

public static intradoc.data.DataBinder callService(intradoc.data.DataBinder serviceBinder)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Calls a Stellent service using the Stellent sysadmin account.

See the callService(DataBinder serviceBinder, String user) method for further information on required configuration for using this method.

Parameters:
serviceBinder - holding the service call parameters
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

callService

public static intradoc.data.DataBinder callService(intradoc.data.DataBinder serviceBinder,
                                                   java.lang.String user)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Calls a Stellent service as a specific user.

This method connects to the content server using an IdcExecuteServer.connectToServer call. By default this attempts to connect to the server using the HttpServerAddress. If you are using a proxy or firewall to connect to the server the HttpServerAddress will resolve to the proxy/firewall rather than the content server. To ensure this function still works when using a proxy you should set the configuration parameter (in config.cfg) IdcCommandServerHost to the server IP address. [You should then ensure that any firewall settings allow connections to the content server port via your defined IP address, for example a connection via the localhost address 127.0.0.1 may by default be blocked.]

Parameters:
serviceBinder - holding the service call parameters
user - Stellent user name
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkBinderForErrors

public static void checkBinderForErrors(intradoc.data.DataBinder binder)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Checks the passed binder for errors. A binder is considered to have an error if it contains a StatusCode attribute with a value of -1. The StatusMessage attribute in the binder will outline the cause of the error in this case. In the case of an error being found in the binder, this is logged using log4j and an exception is thrown, with the value of the StatusMessage attribute passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
binder - DataBinder to check for errors
Returns:
boolean returned indicating whether any errors were found
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
